reviews.review_msg:
I learnt so much in Dr. Leroux's class this semester! The class material can be challenging but there are many opportunities to show your understanding (research paper, presentation, and exams). 

I highly recommend taking a class with Dr.Leroux - he is very kind, a great teacher, and supports student learning!

I thought that the course material was challenging, but Dr. Leroux's annotated lectures were great. He uses a lot of examples from actual scientific articles which helps you understand the key concepts highlighted in the lecture. His tests are difficult because they are about thinking critically rather than memorization, but he is a fair marker.

Dr. Leroux is a fantastic professor who is very passionate about what he teaches. His exams are hard but grading is very generous and fair. All the information you need is in the slides. The paper for this course was an awesome learning experience. Would recommend.

Professor Leroux is a really amazing professor. He is so sweet & you can tell by his lectures how fascinated he is with the material in his teachings. He is very approachable & very kind with his grading. He gave us an extension on the term paper too so we can make it better. Overall I would 100% take any class with him again.

Dr. Leroux is an enthusiastic professor with a passion for molecular biology/biochemistry, and teaching. 
He cares deeply about his students, taking time to answer questions clearly and supporting them when challenges arise. 
His flexibility and understanding made a real difference for me, and I truly appreciate his compassion and dedication.

Dr. Leroux is an amazing professor and very passionate about what he teaches. His lectures are very engaging and straight forward, and he always encourages class discussions on the lecture topics, especially after covering a scientific paper. Overall, a great experience, would definitely recommend.

He is so nice and caring. He gave whole class a full week long extension at the end for final paper. Exams were non-cumulative, and he grades them very fairly and always awards tons of partial marks. He is very passionate about the stuff he teaches. Definitely take his class if you could!

Dr. Leroux taught the class material through experiment-based examples and encouraged developing important skills through a class presentation and research proposal. His exams were a bit challenging and required a good understanding of the material covered in lecture. The exams focused on application of the material rather than just memorization.
Great course. Critical thinking on how proteins interact and function from biogenesis to degradation, with auxillary components involved (broadly).

I took this course as a graduate student. The lectures were very informative and easy to understand. Im normally terrible at test-taking and I did surprisingly well on his exams. Hes very passionate about what he teaches and takes the time to explain concepts clearly. Office hours are especially helpful.
Very interesting course material but hard exams. Take this class if you are hardcore biochem major. Otherwise I wouldn't recommend it. Seems like he picks favorites from the class
exams are hard - dont bother memorizing every little detail; lectures were interesting in the first half of the semester - second half got a little crazy; overall very interesting class
